title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 00:03

jbrBridge left at 06:48 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:08  
vmassol left at 07:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
`cjdelisle joined #xwiki at 07:23  
cjdelisle joined #xwiki at 07:40  
`cjdelisle left at 07:41 (Quit: oops wrong button  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:07  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:41  
rstavro joined #xwiki at 08:45  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 08:47  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:49  
silviar joined #xwiki at 08:49  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 08:54  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 08:56  
sdumitriu - (08:56): vmassol: Ping  
vmassol - (08:56): sdumitriu: pong  
vmassol - (08:56): what we can do if you want is do the release together today  
sdumitriu - (08:56): Do you remember having fixed http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4726 ?  
vmassol - (08:57): hmm checking  
vmassol - (08:59): I think it was fixed but checking the code  
sdumitriu - (08:59): Nope, doesn't work using the page Rename  
marta\_ left at 09:02 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (09:02): ok  
vmassol - (09:05): mflorea: good morning 14 wysiwyg tests failing this morning  
vmassol - (09:05): http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 09:05  
vmassol - (09:06): rest tests failing too, I'm on them.  
vmassol - (09:06): must be caused by the recent activity commits I think  
vmassol - (09:06): (same for wysiwyg)  
mflorea - (09:06): vmassol: good morning. I noticed, but didn't do any changes.. I'll investigate why, but from the failure message it seems some wiki pages from the standard distribution have been changed  
rrodriguez left at 09:06 (Quit: rrodriguez  
vmassol - (09:08): sdumitriu: did you remove some attachments from the Main space?  
Stulle - (09:09): morning  
Stulle - (09:09): i got a bit of a situation on IE 7... apparently the entire layout is screwed up... things keep blending over one another and you can barely view the pages  
Stulle - (09:09): any ideas?  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:10  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 09:10  
mflorea - (09:10): vmassol: it seems so, lquo.gif and rquo.gif are not found on Main.RecentChanges page  
sdumitriu - (09:10): vmassol: Yes  
vmassol - (09:10): mflorea: ok so that's why teh rest tests are failing  
vmassol - (09:10): fixing them  
mflorea - (09:11): same for wysiwyg  
vmassol - (09:11): hmmm attachment tab doesn't work anymore :(  
vmassol - (09:11): http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs?view=attachments  
sdumitriu - (09:11): Works on my older build  
vmassol - (09:11): I get the error "The environment prevents the table from loading data."  
vmassol - (09:11): (cache refresh doesn't help)  
vmassol - (09:12): can someone check if it can be reproduced?  
vmassol - (09:12): delete documetns tab doesn't work either  
vmassol - (09:12): all other tabs are fine  
vmassol - (09:12): so 2 tabs failing: attachments and deleted documents  
vmassol - (09:13): we should really add tests for those if we don't have them  
jbrBridge joined #xwiki at 09:13  
sdumitriu - (09:14): Missing PR?  
vmassol - (09:14): probably  
vmassol - (09:14): seems we have a big regression  
mflorea - (09:14): (XWikiGuest appears on Recent Activity)  
sdumitriu - (09:14): Hm, could be from the xwiki.js cleanup that jvelociter did  
vmassol - (09:15): mflorea: yep I reported this yesterday  
mflorea - (09:15): yep  
jvelociter - (09:15): let me check  
mflorea - (09:16): vmassol: attachments tab works for me  
mflorea - (09:16): 2.6-SNAPSHOT.32305  
vmassol - (09:16): I built yesterday night around 10:30  
vmassol - (09:17): let me check if there have been more svn changes  
mflorea - (09:17): deleted attachments tab works too, although it's empty, but that's normal  
jbrBridge - (09:17): [CalebJamesDeLisle] "[04:03:13] <[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)> There can I find a detailed documentation of the template mechanism (Template Provider) ?  
jbrBridge - (09:17): [CalebJamesDeLisle] Especially - can I use variables? (e.g. $title)"  Sorry the bridge was down (kernel b00m)  This page has some info about the  variables. http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
vmassol - (09:17): mflorea: it's less than empty for me  
vmassol - (09:17): (the livetable doesn't even show)  
vmassol - (09:18): mflorea: no changes in svn since I last built  
vmassol - (09:18): ah no there's one  
vmassol - (09:18): Dashboard.xml  
vmassol - (09:18): but I doubt this is changing anything  
mflorea - (09:19): I cleared my cache and it is still working  
mflorea - (09:19): I don't know what could be different (my XE instance is taken from maven, I didn't build it myself)  
mflorea - (09:21): sdumitriu: lquo.gif and rquo.gif attachments have been removed? I can't find them on the attachment list  
sdumitriu - (09:21): Yes, they weren't used anymore  
mflorea - (09:22): ok, I'll update the wysiwyg tests to use a different image attacmhent  
jvelociter - (09:28): vmassol: all tabs/livetables work for me as well, same as mflorea . Have you cleared your cache? what have you built exactly ?  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:28  
vmassol - (09:31): jvelociter: I'm redownloading a new version to check  
jbrBridge - (09:32): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Templates:  
jbrBridge - (09:32): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I use now:  
jbrBridge - (09:32): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] https://www.computer42.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevNotes/XWiki#Hpagetitlebyreference  
jbrBridge - (09:33): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] = {{velocity}}$doc.getDisplayTitle(){{/velocity}}  =  
jbrBridge - (09:34): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Another question:  
jbrBridge - (09:34): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] How can I specify in xwiki 2.0 syntax a link to a subsection of the current/another page ?  
cjdelisle - (09:35): I think the link syntax would be [[name>>Space.Page#section]]  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:39  
sburjan - (09:48): XASCH-57  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:50  
sdumitriu - (09:53): vmassol: You're the release manager for 2.6, right?  
sburjan - (09:56): are we aware that annotations don't work on blog ?  
sburjan - (09:57): also on the blog page we have an unrendered &  
sburjan - (09:59): also found a typo in xwiki.cfg  
cjdelisle - (10:00): Yes, where was this typo?  
cjdelisle - (10:00): If you have a patch, I will apply it today (unless the release train has already left the station...)  
sburjan - (10:01): sdumitriu: is gonna fix it :)  
sburjan - (10:01): reporting the blog typo and annotations  
sdumitriu - (10:03): xwiki.cfg typo fixed  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:04  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:07  
sburjan - (10:10): great  
vmassol - (10:11): sdumitriu: yes I'd like to be but I also know I'll be short on time  
sburjan - (10:11): XAANNOTATIONS-36  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:14  
sburjan - (10:16): XABLOG-112  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 10:21  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:21  
Stulle - (10:31): just a thought, is there a possibility to include just a section of a page in another page?  
jbrBridge - (10:31): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Is there also a way to provide stable anchors for a heading ?  
Stulle - (10:31): right now i am extracting sections to a new page in order to be able to include them in two separate pages  
vmassol - (10:31): Stulle: we have an open jira issue fror this  
vmassol - (10:32): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-1776  
Stulle - (10:32): oh, cool. good to know  
Stulle - (10:32): thanks  
tmortagne - (10:32): [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection): you can use id macro for that, it insert a anchor for which you decide the id youself, see http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/IdMacro  
tmortagne - (10:33): but a header id is supposed to always the same if you don't change the header itself  
rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 10:34  
rrodriguez left at 10:34 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
rrodriguez\_ is now known as rrodriguez ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol - (10:37): rest tests should be fixed (need a better fix for the future for better stability though)  
vmassol - (10:38): guys I've just downloaded the latest hudson build for XE and the tabs are still failing  
vmassol - (10:39): (jvelociter: and yes I have refreshed my cache)  
sdumitriu - (10:39): vmassol: Downloading myself  
vmassol - (10:39): mflorea: I'm on XWIKI ENTERPRISE 2.6-SNAPSHOT.32305  
vmassol - (10:40): (same as yours)  
sdumitriu - (10:40): vmassol: Try a different browser?  
jvelociter - (10:40): vmassol: strange. What browser do you use ?  
vmassol - (10:40): I have already  
vmassol - (10:40): tried with chrome and FF  
vmassol - (10:41): hmm works on safari  
vmassol - (10:42): works now on all  
jvelociter - (10:43): :)  
sdumitriu - (10:43): See, problem solved  
jvelociter - (10:43): magic magic !  
vmassol - (10:43): not sure it's solved....  
mflorea - (10:43): :)  
vmassol - (10:43): still trying to figure things out  
sdumitriu - (10:43): Bugs tend to disappear when I'm going near them  
jvelociter - (10:43): (I've concentred deeply to fix your browser)  
jvelociter - (10:43): hehe  
vmassol - (10:43): I still have a pb with the deleted docs tab  
vmassol - (10:44): it's ok in safari though  
vmassol - (10:50): does anyone have anything left to commit for 2.6RC1? (I hope not)  
vmassol - (10:50): (not talking about bug fix to stabilize 2.6RC1)  
jvelociter - (10:51): shouldn't we fix the bug about macros not found on first XAR import ?  
sburjan - (10:51): where can I see a list of all emoticons available ?  
vmassol - (10:51): sburjan: http://www.famfamfam.com/lab/icons/silk/previews/index\_abc.png  
vmassol - (10:51): we need to document that on the new syntax page  
sburjan - (10:52): we support all of these ?  
vmassol - (10:52): the new page that we don't have yet  
vmassol - (10:52): yes we support them all FTM  
sburjan - (10:52): interesting :)  
vmassol - (10:52): now we only support a subset as syntax symbols  
sburjan - (10:53): the only problem is that I don't know the syntax for them  
vmassol - (10:53): icon:<name>  
sburjan - (10:53): oh .. I was using :) as ":)"  
vmassol - (10:53): you're tlaking about special symbol syntax here  
vmassol - (10:53): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-transformations/xwiki-rendering-transformation-icon/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/transformation/icon/DefaultIconTransformationConfiguration.java  
sburjan - (10:53): no with icon:<name>  
sburjan - (10:54): oh  
vmassol - (10:54): there are 2 different things  
vmassol - (10:54): the generic syntax  
vmassol - (10:54): which is icon:<name>  
sdumitriu - (10:54): vmassol: XE-709 is a bit critical, but I'll fix it for RC2  
jvelociter - (10:54): lucaa: are you working on XE-727 ?  
sdumitriu - (10:54): jvelociter: That's hard to fix, it requires changes in the core  
vmassol - (10:54): sburjan: and the special syntax for some of them which is completely ocnfigurable by the user  
vmassol - (10:55): sdumitriu: we also still have the first time display issue  
jvelociter - (10:55): sdumitriu: I really think we need it fixed  
vmassol - (10:55): we should mark all of these in jira as blockers for RC2  
jvelociter - (10:55): it's quite odd  
sburjan - (10:55): I understand. I think we have to create a separate page for the icon:<name> syntax  
sdumitriu - (10:55): jvelociter: Agreed, but who wants to do it  
vmassol - (10:56): sburjan: page?  
jvelociter - (10:56): yes we need to decide how we fix it  
sburjan - (10:56): vmassol: I'm talking about documentation.  
vmassol - (10:56): sburjan: we cannot put that in the old xwiki syntax page  
vmassol - (10:56): it has to be in the revamped one  
vmassol - (10:56): as I mentioned  
sburjan - (10:56): yes  
vmassol - (10:56): which is why I asked you a long time ago about working on it  
vmassol - (10:56): but now  
sdumitriu - (10:56): jvelociter: Currently the import logic orders documents so that classes are imported first  
jvelociter - (10:56): I was just checking with anca she did not started something before we are sure we want to fix it like that  
vmassol - (10:56): I've asked caty to work on the design of it  
sdumitriu - (10:56): It could be adapted to also prioritize macros  
jvelociter - (10:56): because when she says "One solution would be to do the check of the document author user, and not the current use" that can be a security breach]  
jvelociter - (10:57): yes if we are doing it already for classes, we could do it for macros too I guess  
cjdelisle - (10:57): ``<sdumitriu> It could be adapted to also prioritize macros'' that's bad  
cjdelisle - (11:00): IIRC the macros would have to be moved to the end. Package just takes the xar file as the zip stream gives it, put the macros at the end of the zip file and it'll work.  
tmortagne - (11:00): cjdelisle: at the begining you mean ? context user is checked, not macro author  
tmortagne - (11:01): if you put it at the end then context user will be checked when he lost admin rights  
vmassol - (11:01): in any case this is a quick fix for now, we'll need something more robust later on  
vmassol - (11:01): (some food for thoughts tmortagne for the new xar importer)  
sdumitriu - (11:01): cjdelisle: Why bad?  
tmortagne - (11:01): vmassol: next xar importe will not do any order, no way  
tmortagne - (11:02): it should be pure streaming  
jvelociter - (11:02): do we agree to mark that issue as blocker and fix for 2.6RC1 2.5.1 ?  
rrodriguez left at 11:02 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
tmortagne - (11:02): otherwise we get the same crap we have today where it's impossible to import anything big  
vmassol - (11:02): tmortagne: hmm right....  
vmassol - (11:02): still we need to fix the order issue somewhere  
tmortagne - (11:03): but maven xar plugin can  
cjdelisle - (11:04): If we put the macros at the beginning then we have to define the macro class first. We will have to hope that the macro class (and any other class used by macros) doesn't have any dependencies which pull in XWikiPreferences.  
vmassol - (11:05): ok deleted docs tab works now too…. I guess I didn't clear my cache correctly (I thought shift + refresh was enough but apparently not)  
tmortagne - (11:06): cjdelisle: XWikiPreferences is created when you start XWiki anyway it's just overwritten by XE xar  
jbrBridge - (11:06): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Tags - I was used that if I enter a tag the matching possibilities are shown.  
jbrBridge - (11:06): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] On my xwiki 2.4 (.4) installation this is broken. It is still working on xwiki.org (2.3).  
jbrBridge - (11:06): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Can somebody confirm this ?  
tmortagne - (11:06): it's possible it's the same for macro cclass  
tmortagne - (11:06): like all others "system" classes  
vmassol - (11:07): http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1390902/cache-refresh-in-chrome  
sdumitriu - (11:08): vmassol: I've changed my mind, xwiki/2.1 should be enabled  
cjdelisle - (11:08): "<sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Why bad?" I suppose it's not horrible to hack a hack once again but it will be a lot of work for something which still needs replacing asap.  
vmassol - (11:08): sdumitriu: ah cool  
sdumitriu - (11:08): cjdelisle: OK, it's bad as in "it's not good"  
vmassol - (11:08): I'd rather have it enabled too  
vmassol - (11:08): sending mail  
sburjan - (11:09): we could enable xwiki/2.1 to be displayed from panels too, but  the default syntax could remain xwiki/2.0 when creating pages  
vmassol - (11:09): sure  
vmassol - (11:09): it shoudln't be the default  
vmassol - (11:10): mail sent  
sburjan - (11:26): still waiting for that e-mail :P  
asrfel - (11:28): vmassol: how can i get all the links contained by a document ? I mean, I am in a rename method, and i want to update the links in case the rename takes the document to another space. What method from XDOM should i call to get all the links from inside the document ?  
tmortagne - (11:29): asrfel: you have API in Document/XWikiDocument for that, not need to plain with XDOM directly  
tmortagne - (11:29): that's what is used in the UI to rename a document  
vmassol - (11:30): asrfel: are you providing a patch for the rename bug?  
sburjan - (11:30): :)  
asrfel - (11:30): yes, i am working on it  
vmassol - (11:30): cool  
tmortagne - (11:30): s/plain/play/  
asrfel - (11:30): yes  
sburjan - (11:31): asrfel: you can check on the information tab / Backlinks section  
asrfel - (11:31): tmortagne: what is the method you are talking about ?  
vmassol - (11:31): XWIKI-4726 right?  
marta\_ left at 11:31 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
asrfel - (11:31): vmassol : right  
tmortagne - (11:31): Document#getLinks for example and there is more in XWikiDocument  
asrfel - (11:32): tmortagne : thanks. looking into it ;)  
tmortagne - (11:33): see getUniqueLinkedPages in XWikiDocument  
mflorea left at 11:33 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (11:34): i have to go, back in 1 or 2h  
lucaa - (11:41): so, here we go, about XE-727 I just had an enlightning talk with jvelociter. What if we call WikiMacroInitializer#registerExistingWikiMacros (or XWiki#registerWikiMacros() ) after doing the import? either by sending an import event or by just calling the function?  
sburjan - (11:42): XPAS-25  
lucaa - (11:43): ( sdumitriu, tmortagne, cjdelisle, vmassol ? )  
cjdelisle - (11:45): I can't think of a good reason to dislike it.  
jvelociter - (11:46): same, it sounds like our safest move right now  
arkub left at 11:56 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
evalica joined #xwiki at 11:57  
cjdelisle - (12:01): Does anyone have opinions about the idea of separating the attachment content storage from the attachment metadata storage interface?  
vmassol - (12:01): for now yes but we should remove the xwikiguest who has all rights and instead force the user to log in as superadmin so that right are not changed during the import  
vmassol - (12:02): s/right/rights/  
vmassol - (12:02): (something like this)  
cjdelisle - (12:02): I was thinking about storage rather than import.  
cjdelisle - (12:03): XWikiAttachmentStoreInterface is a huge mess. It appears to be derived from XWikiHibernateAttachmentStore.  
cjdelisle - (12:04): Things like documentUpdate demand that hibernate be employed even if the attachment store is supposed to be a separate concern.  
cjdelisle - (12:06): "implementation of XWikiAttachmentStoreInterface" <-- legacy compatability code goes here.  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:08  
cjdelisle - (12:10): OTOH more interfaces for core comparability which will probably all be dropped... maybe not any improvement.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 12:17  
vmassol - (12:27): jvdrean: is the template's box on broken link click created by js?  
jvdrean - (12:28): vmassol: yes  
vmassol - (12:28): ok then maybe it's the problem of the flickering test  
vmassol - (12:28): ok trying to fix it  
vmassol - (12:29): jvdrean: where is the js located?  
jvdrean - (12:30): https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/trunk/standard/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/xwiki.js  
jvdrean - (12:31): insertCreatePageFromTemplateModalBoxes  
jvdrean - (12:31): called from initialize  
vmassol - (12:31): thanks  
jvdrean - (12:33): is the fact that it is flickering new ?  
vmassol - (12:33): I don't think so  
vmassol - (12:34): but I don't know for sure  
jvdrean - (12:35): ok, it's at least the 3rd day it is flickering AFAICS on hudson  
vmassol - (12:38): jvdrean: I also think we need a new api to click on a broken link, in ViewPage.  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 12:40  
rstavro - (12:41): @mflorea and @vmassol: the reason why XWikiGuest appears in Recent Activity is the fact that activitystream plugin handles events launched by this user and $xwiki.getUserName($event.user) returns 'XWikiGuest'  
vmassol - (12:41): rstavro: ok could you also reply on the list? We need to fix this  
vmassol - (12:42): since if you look at the page it's created by "superadmin"  
vmassol - (12:42): i guess jv was doing a hack before, jvdrean?  
vmassol - (12:43): (because I seem to remember recent changes was displaying admin or superadmin before)  
rstavro - (12:43): ok, I understand  
rstavro - (12:43): I'll check the way this situation was handled before  
jvdrean - (12:45): what's the issue ? XWikiGuest appears instead of superadmin in the new recent changes ?  
rstavro - (12:45): yes  
jvdrean - (12:46): I don't remember a workaround about this in the watchlist  
jvdrean - (12:46): is it possible that $event.user is not set ?  
lucaa left at 12:47 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
flaviusolaru left at 12:47 (Quit: Leaving.  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 12:49  
evalica - (12:52): @vmassol "Also if I click on XWikiGuest it goes to a non existing page (since  XWikiGuest user doesn't exist). I think we shouldn't make XWikiGuest  clickable. " I tested and is not clickable  
rstavro - (12:52): @jvdrean: no, the user is set to XWiki.XWikiGuest, si it's not empty  
rstavro - (12:52): s/si/so  
evalica - (12:53): @vmassol: you were clicking on the snapshot  (avatar) - k  
Enygma` - (12:54): Hi guys... does anyone know why, when saving an XWiki document in the XWikiStore, we set the original document to be a clone of the document that was just been saved? see: https://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/XWikiHibernateStore.java?r=HEAD#l648  
cjdelisle - (12:55): I think it has to do with sending the correct document in the notifications.  
cjdelisle - (12:55): Are you asking why it's a clone?  
jvelociter - (12:56): evalica: some thoughts about my mail/proposal for the suggest redesign ?  
Enygma` - (12:57): I thought the clone should be done before, not after everything is done... because we end up with a document that has itself as the original document  
Enygma` - (12:57): and then, when needing to notify, we do a hack like this: https://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java?r=HEAD#l1415  
venkatesh left at 12:57 (Remote host closed the connection  
Enygma` - (12:57): I am asking about it, because I have a problem implementind a document change listener that modifies a document's object and saves the document  
Enygma` - (12:58): and which relies on the value of that object in the current and in the original document  
evalica - (12:58): jvelociter: haven't yet read it - sorry  
jvelociter - (12:58): np - take your time :)  
Enygma` - (12:59): when saving the document (because I modify the object), my save gets overriden by the "magic" done here https://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java?r=HEAD#l1468  
Enygma` - (12:59): and next time I need to look at the original document, I don`t see my change... since it was overriden  
cjdelisle - (13:00): So the problem is that the notifications are given with the document 1 revision older than it should be.  
Enygma` - (13:00): so there's saveDocument1 > changeListener1 > saveDocument2 > changeListener2 (does nothing) > end saveDocument2 > end changeListener 1 > end saveDocument1  
Enygma` - (13:01): more or less... since the loop can be deeper  
flaviusolaru left at 13:01 (Quit: Leaving.  
Enygma` - (13:01): what I described 2 lines above is the "stack trace" that is problematic wrt saving the original document  
Enygma` - (13:02): since end saveDocument1 sets the original document to something else than it should be.  
cjdelisle - (13:02): I don't know why it is that way.  
cjdelisle - (13:03): sdumitriu?  
sdumitriu - (13:03): Bad code?  
Enygma` - (13:03): the store should take care of it correctly and we should avoid this hacking to preserve the original document  
sdumitriu - (13:03): The store implementation is probably the ugliest code in the platform  
Enygma` - (13:03): I see both JCR and Hibernate implementations of the store respect this "convention" of setting the original document as the clone of the saved document.  
Enygma` - (13:04): wouldn`t this be fixed if the clone() would be performed at the beginning of saveXWikiDocument() instead of the end?  
sdumitriu - (13:04): Yes  
Enygma` - (13:05): and then the core around the event notification could be removed  
Enygma` - (13:06): \*code
